title: Using the Power Rule to Simplify
text: We can use the power rule as follows. We know that the exponent that $$\log_{b}\left(M^n\right)=n\log_{b}\left(M\right)$$. In this case, $$M=x$$ and $$n=2$$. This means that $$\ln(x^2)=2ln(x)$$
speech: We can use the power rule as follows. We know that the exponent that  the log base b of, parentheses   m to the n-th,  is equal to n the log base b of   m . In this case,    m is equal to x  and  n, is equal to 2 . This means that , the natural log of, parentheses x squared  is equal to, 2 l n of x
